intro: Bidens prolixus, commonly known as the common beggar’s ticks, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by attachment to animals or clothing, aiding in its spread. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in roadsides, fields, and wetlands. Its invasive growth habit makes it a common weed in many regions.
